wikipedia_page.main: General Sir Brian Leslie Graham Kenny  (18 June 1934 – 19 June 2017) was a senior British Army officer, who served as Deputy Supreme Allied Commander Europe from 1990 until his retirement in 1993.

response: |18. || General Sir Brian Kenny || || January 17, 1990 || April 5, 1993||  British Army
*Brian Kenny (British Army officer) (1934–2017), British Army General
*Brian Kenny (politician), Liberal member of the Legislative Assembly of New Brunswick
*Brian Kenny (sportscaster) (born 1963), MLB Network personality and journalist

link_mentions.page: List of British Army full generals

response: He was promoted to lieutenant colonel on 30 June 1976. He was then appointed Commanding Officer of 1st Battalion, Royal Welch Fusiliers. He commanded the 700 military personnel who replaced firefighters during the 1977 Fire Brigades Union nationwide strike. He was once more posted to Northern Ireland between 1 February and 30 April 1979. He was a member of the directing staff of the Royal College of Defence Studies from late 1979 to 1981. He was promoted to brigadier on 31 December 1981, with seniority from 30 June 1981. Between December 1981 and January 1984, he was commanding officer of the Gurkha Field Force, based in Hong Kong. He was posted to the Ministry of Defence as Deputy Director of Army Staff Duties from February 1984 to February 1985. He was the last person to hold that appointment. From February 1985 to January 1987, he remained at the MOD as Director of Army Staff Duties. He was the successor of the then Major General Brian Kenny.
* General Sir Brian Kenny, KCB, CBE (437098), Colonel The Queen's Royal Irish Hussars, Colonel Commandant Royal Armoured Corps, Colonel Commandant Royal Army Veterinary Corps.

link_mentions.page: Outline of the British Army at the end of the Cold War
response: On 27 November 1989 Peter Inge became the commander of NATO's Northern Army Group and Commander-in-Chief, British Army of the Rhine in Germany with the local rank of general; he succeeded General Brian Kenny.
